prompt.item: What do you like to be called?

grammar.item: Why do you need to know?
I don't want to give it!

prompt.item: I can help you find recipes. Are you in the mood for a specific cuisine?
Let's get cooking! Do you have a particular cuisine in mind?
I find the recipes, you do the cooking. What kind of cuisine do you prefer?
What can I do for you?
I'm not sure what you mean. Try Look up American recipes.
I'm afraid I don't understand. I can't recognize dish names at this time.
I'm sorry, I don't understand. Try Indian dish with potatoes
Is there anything else I can help you with?
Did you find what you were looking for, {User_Name}?
Oh no. Do you want to try again?
Okay. What can I do for you?
This is fun, but wouldn't you like to look up some recipes?
American, Caribbean, Chinese, French, Greek, Indian, Italian, Japanese, Mediterranean, Mexican, Spanish, Thai, and Vietnamese.
I'm afraid {Topic} isn't a cuisine I know. Please try another one.
I'm sorry I don't know about that. Can I look up some recipes for you?
I'm afraid I don't know much about {Topic}. Just recipes.
I can look up recipes by cuisine or ingredients. But I'm afraid I cannot do much else at this time.
Wouldn't you rather find a recipe?

grammar.item: I want to search for recipes

prompt.item: Are you in the mood for a specific cuisine?
Do you prefer a certain cuisine?
What kind of cuisine do you like?
Sorry, {Topic} isn't a cuisine that I know. Please try another one.
American, Caribbean, Chinese, French, Greek, Indian, Italian, Japanese, Mediterranean, Mexican, Spanish, Thai, and Vietnamese.
Well, I don't eat much, but I like Italian food.
Do you prefer a certain primary ingredient?
Do you have a primary ingredient in mind?
Do you have a main ingredient you'd like to use?
Vegetables such as broccoli, carrots and peas. Meat and poultry such as beef, chicken and turkey. Rice, eggs, ,etc.
I'm afraid I found {Num_Recipes} recipes matching {Ingredients_Preference} {Cuisine_Preference}. Try changing your criteria.
Fine choice, {User_Name}! I found {Num_Recipes} results for {Ingredients_Preference} recipes.
Nice choice, {User_Name}! I found {Num_Recipes} results for {Cuisine_Preference} recipes.
I found {Num_Recipes} results for ALL recipes.
Good choices, {User_Name}! I found {Num_Recipes} results for {Cuisine_Preference} {Ingredients_Preference} recipes.
Is there anything else I can help you with?
These are the recipes I found. Go ahead and click one!
No. Say show me more if you want to see more.
Yes. I'm afraid that's all of them.
I'm sorry to hear that. Try changing your criteria.
I'm afraid {Topic} isn't a cuisine I know. Please try another one.

"{Search_Now:"{Search_Now}", Ingredients:"{Ingredients_Preference}", Cuisine:"{Cuisine_Preference}", Index:"{Current_Index}", Page:"{Page}", Total_Recipes:"{Num_Recipes}", Total_Pages:"{Total_Pages}"}"
Here is the next set of results

"{Search_Now:"{Search_Now}", Ingredients:"{Ingredients_Preference}", Cuisine:"{Cuisine_Preference}", Index:"{Current_Index}", Page:"{Page}", Total_Recipes:"{Num_Recipes}", Total_Pages:"{Total_Pages}"}"
Here is the previous set of results
I'm sorry, English is my second language. My native tongue is Binary. 01110011 01101111 01110010 01110010 01111001
Well, I don't eat much, but I like Italian food.
Oh... I don't eat much, but I hear Indian is good.
Try saying What's in theaters? or I want to see a comedy.
Say Never mind or & nvm to start over. Say okay or & thanks if my response is acceptable. Say What does X mean? for a definition of X. Say got to go or bye when you're finished.
I'm sorry, please repeat it for me.

grammar.item: I want to speak to a person

prompt.item: I'm sorry, I don't have anyone to transfer you to.
I'm sorry. I still have a lot to learn.
Fantastic! So glad to hear it.
You're very polite, but don't you want me to look up recipes for you?
You're very polite, but don't you want me to look up recipes for you?

value.name: you just want to chit chat
look up recipes by cuisine and ingredients
look up recipes by their cuisine

var.name: Class1_Confidence
var.description: Confidence score for Class1 from NL classifier

var.name: Class2_Confidence
var.description: Confidence score for Class2 from NL classifier

var.name: Combined_Confidence
var.description: Class1_Confidence + Class2_Confidence

var.name: Class1_Text
var.description: Display text for class1

var.name: Class2_Text
var.description: Display text for class2

var.name: Previous_Class
var.description: Place to store utterance class

var.name: Array_Lookup
var.initValue: <SearchRecipes>look up recipes</SearchRecipes><OtherClass>do something else</OtherClass><GiveName>that's your name</GiveName><OpeningTalk>to greet me</OpeningTalk><ClosingTalk>to say goodbye</ClosingTalk><SmallTalk>you just want to chit chat</SmallTalk><RepairTalk>you don't understand</RepairTalk><PreSequence>to check on something</PreSequence><YesClass>to say yes</YesClass><NoClass>to say no</NoClass><3rdTurnReceipts>just acknowledging me</3rdTurnReceipts>
var.description: For matching Class1 to Class1_Text

var.name: Defaulted_Previous
var.description: Whether input has hit Default node already

var.name: Greeting_Count
var.description: How many times a user says "hi" or "howareyou"

var.name: Small_Talk_Count
var.description: How many times User engages Small Talk sequences

var.name: Out-of-Scope_Count
var.description: How many times User engages out-of-scope sequences

var.name: First_Time
var.description: User's first time using the app.

var.name: Request_Success
var.description: Did the user find what s/he was looking for?

var.name: Terminal_Exchange
var.description: Has the system already said goodbye?

var.name: Search_Results
var.description: No_Hits, One_Hit, Multiple_Hits

var.name: Num_Recipes
var.description: Number of recipe search results

var.name: Current_Index
var.description: Range of recipes results to display. Values: 10, 20, 30...

var.name: Show_Next
var.description: Show the next batch of recipe search results.

var.name: Show_Previous
var.description: Show previous batch of recipes search results.

var.name: Total_Pages
var.description: Total number of pages returned by TMDB

var.name: Last_Results
var.description: Determines if user has hit the Last Results node before.

var.name: First_Results
var.description: Determines if user has gone back to first results already.

var.name: Page
var.description: For paging search results: new, next, previous, repeat

var.name: Ingredients_Preference
var.description: User's preferred ingredients

var.name: Cuisine_Preference
var.description: User's preferred cuisine.

var.name: Search_Now
var.description: Tells backend when to call the recipe API
